intro: Echinocereus viridiflorus var. intermedius, commonly known as the Intermediate Greenflower Cactus, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, spiny cactus that typically grows to a height of 10–20 inches, featuring a cylindrical stem with prominent areoles and white to yellow spines. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are clustered at the tips of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes. This variety is known for its drought tolerance and ability to store water in its fleshy stems.
